pr_title: SAMZA-2585: Modify shutdown sequence to handle orphaned AMs

timeline.message: Modify shutdown sequence for orphaned AMs
Modify test for shutdown sequence for orphaned AMs

timeline.bodyText: why not leverage stop(SamzaAppStatus.FAILED) up top? I like some additional logs. so maybe modify the stop(...) to include this logs for better debuggability.
timeline.author: mynameborat

timeline.bodyText: can we add some comments around what this scenario (app attempt removed from RM cache) means and also update the log statement to reflect it? It will be helpful for folks who don't have much context on YARN.
timeline.author: mynameborat

timeline.bodyText:
Can this throw some other exception? What is our expectation if this is unsuccessful? Should we still try to shutdown the rest of the components or just crash the JVM?
I'd prefer former, to handle other kind of exception if any and try to shutdown the AM as clean as possible.
timeline.author: mynameborat

replies.bodyText: Handled all the exceptions this can throw.
replies.author: PawasChhokra

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps add cases for unregister throwing exceptions too.
timeline.author: mynameborat

timeline.bodyText: should we also verify if unregister is called? Since if we don't unregister, we will end up retrying and its important this code path doesn't get broken when someone modifies to use a different status to invoke lifecycle.onShutdown(...)
timeline.author: mynameborat

timeline.bodyText: AM isn't dead yet right? Shouldn't this be once the NM dies Which brings up another interesting question. Have you validated the behavior when yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled is set to true vs false?
timeline.author: mynameborat

replies.bodyText: Fixed the log. Also validated with yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled set to true. It works as expected.
replies.author: PawasChhokra

timeline.bodyText: nit: avoid * imports and import explicitly.
timeline.author: mynameborat
